message.content:
cs.SI, cs.SOC, cs.DS, cs.MA, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with the problem of Influence Maximization (IM) in large-scale networks, which is a core problem in social network analysis and has applications in viral marketing, epidemic control, and assessing cascading failures within complex systems. Therefore, cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.SOC (Social and Economic Networks) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper proposes two novel sampling frameworks for IM-based viral marketing problems, which involve innovative Stop-and-Stare strategy and use minimum numbers of samples, meeting strict theoretical thresholds characterized for IM. Therefore, cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.MA (Multiagent Systems) are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper uses approximation algorithms and statistical evidence to evaluate the proposed frameworks, which are related to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
